item.title: Automatic Multi-Step Code Migrations with Nx
item.description: Apart from the framework itself, one outcome from Google’s Angular team is for sure the tooling. One important tooling feature is the ability to automatically upgrade Angular codebases across breaking changes. Let’s see how that works and why it is important.

item.title: I'm new to Nx. Where do I get started?
item.description: If you are new to Nx, but curious, here are a couple of pointers and links where and how to get started.

item.title: Create Nx Libs with Assets
item.description: One of the core pieces of Nx are libraries. They enable to seamlessly share functionality across various apps and other libs within the monorepository. Exporting code is easy, but how can we export things like assets?

item.title: Debug Jest with VSCode
item.description: Jest has become the goto testing framework in the frontend space, whether it is for React or for Angular. In Nx it is even the default choice when generating a new Angular app. Debugging can be a bit more cumbersome though, in contrast to Karma. Let’s see.
